[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: set_asset_max()] [Max Decrease Attack] If admin decreases max below active flash loan amounts, can in-flight flash loans with amount > new max fail to repay due to validation mismatches? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: set_asset_min()] [Min Increase Attack] If admin increases min above active flash loan amounts, can this orphan existing loans that can't be repaid because they don't meet new minimum? (Low)

(High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Split Error Handling] Line 196 calls balance::split which can abort if insufficient balance - can this be exploited to leave receipt consumed but repayment incomplete, stealing flash loan funds? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Deposit Failure] Line 197 calls pool::deposit_balance with repay balance - if deposit fails after split, can funds be lost in transaction limbo between split and deposit? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Treasury Deposit Ordering] Line 198 deposits treasury fees after main deposit at line 197 - can pool state changes between these calls cause treasury deposit to fail while main deposit succeeds? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Remaining Balance] Line 208 returns _repay_balance after splits - can caller drain remaining balance without penalty, effectively getting free flash loan on the excess? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: loan()] [Balance Type Safety] Line 155 returns Balance<CoinType> - can type parameter mismatch between loan and repay allow attacker to repay with wrong coin type? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [State Update Timing] Line 182 calls logic::update_state_of_all before computing scaled fees - can stale state cause incorrect supply index to be used for fee calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Index Retrieval] Line 186 calls storage::get_index(storage, asset_id) - can asset_id mismatch between loan and repay cause index to be fetched for wrong asset? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Cumulate to Supply] Line 189 calls logic::cumulate_to_supply_index(storage, asset_id, scaled_fee_to_supplier) - can scaled_fee_to_supplier be manipulated to inflate supply index and drain protocol reserves? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Interest Rate Update] Line 190 calls logic::update_interest_rate after cumulating fees - can this cause interest rate to spike based on fee amounts, griefing normal borrowers? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Asset ID Mismatch] Line 183 derives asset_id from type name but line 189 uses it to update storage - can type name collision cause fees to be credited to wrong asset's suppliers? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Ray Math Precision] Line 187 uses ray_math::ray_div for scaled fee calculation - can precision loss in ray division cause accumulated fees to drift from actual fees collected? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/flash_loan.move] [Function: repay()] [Normal Amount Conversion] Line 185 calls pool::normal_amount with fee_to_supplier - if this conversion uses different rounding than loan fee calculation, can attacker profit from rounding differences?
